titleStmt.title: The boaster bared, and his armour put off, without a conquest, by the quaking principle. In an answer to Enoch Hovvets, called Quaking principles dasht in pieces. / Written by James Nayler.
titleStmt.author: Naylor, James, 1617?-1660.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for G. Calvert, and are to be sold at his shop at the Black Spread Eagle, neer the west end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
